title: Instinctive protection
description: A natural defense mechanism that protects an organism from harm.

title: Intangible asset
description: Something valuable that a company owns but that is not physical, such as a brand name or intellectual property.

title: Intern
description: A student or trainee who works, sometimes without pay, at a company or organization to gain practical experience.

title: Investigate
description: To examine something carefully, especially to discover the truth about it.

title: Irrigation
description: The supply of water to land or crops to help growth.

title: Jump on the bandwagon
description: To join an activity or movement that has become popular or successful.

title: Jump to conclusions
description: To make a decision or judgment before having all the facts.

title: Jury
description: A group of people, typically twelve, who are selected to hear evidence in a court of law and give a verdict.

title: Keep someone in the loop
description: To keep someone informed about a process or situation.

title: Kidnapping
description: Taking someone away illegally by force, typically for ransom or other unlawful purpose.

title: Leave at the altar
description: To abandon someone at the last minute, especially just before a wedding.

title: Let something down
description: To release or deflate something that was previously held up or inflated.

title: Let something out
description: To allow something to escape or to make something larger.

title: Liaison
description: A communication or cooperation that facilitates a close working relationship between people or organizations.

title: License plate
description: A metal or plastic plate attached to a vehicle, bearing a unique alphanumeric code for identification.

title: Lit
description: Full of energy, great, or exciting.

title: Lovers' Lane
description: A secluded road or path, typically for romantic couples.

title: Low-hanging fruit
description: Something that is easy to achieve or solve.

title: Make a U-turn
description: To turn a vehicle around in the opposite direction, often used metaphorically for a complete change in opinion or policy.

title: Make out
description: To manage to see, hear, or understand something with difficulty, or to engage in kissing and sexual activity.

title: Master multitasker
description: Someone who is very good at doing many things at once.

title: Maternal foresight
description: A mother's ability to anticipate future needs or problems and plan accordingly.

title: Maternal instinct
description: A natural tendency for mothers to care for and protect their children.

title: Mean business
description: To be serious and determined about something.

title: Memory keeper
description: A person or thing that preserves or records memories.
